steps: 1. Weigh out 8.0 g of erbium, 1.0 g of indium, 5.0 g of antimony, and 2.0 g of thulium using an analytical balance. 2. Place the weighed materials in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the materials together to ensure uniform mixing. 4. Transfer the mixed powders back into the crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 8.0 g of erbium, 1.0 g of indium, 5.0 g of antimony, and 2.0 g of thulium using an analytical balance. 2. Place the weighed materials in a clean, dry ceramic crucible. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the materials together to ensure uniform mixing. 4. Transfer the mixed powders back into the crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C (2192°F). 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders in the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C (2192°F). 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders in the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to 800°C (1472°F) naturally. 2. Once the furnace reaches 800°C, carefully remove the crucible using heat-resistant gloves. 3. Place the crucible on a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to 800°C (1472°F) naturally. 2. Once the furnace reaches 800°C, carefully remove the crucible using heat-resistant gloves. 3. Place the crucible on a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours).

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect the sample for any surface imperfections. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces as needed. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
